QAPair.Question: What is (are) Deep vein thrombosis - discharge ?
QAPair.Answer: You were treated for deep vein thrombosis ( DVT ). This is a condition in which a blood clot forms in a vein that is not on or near the surface of the body. It mainly affects the large veins in the lower leg and thigh. The clot can block blood flow. If the clot breaks off and moves through the bloodstream, it can get stuck in the blood vessels in the lungs.
